hedline.hl1: It's Off to the Races This Father's Day

block.p: For 64-year-old JOE BOLSTER of Princeton, N.J., Father's Day will mean rising at 4 A.M. to accompany his wife, TINK, age 63, to White Plains, site of the Danskins Women's Triathlon presented by B.M.W.

Tink Bolster, no triathlon tyro, will compete against a field of about 1,000 women next Sunday. She will be the oldest competitor -- but probably not the last -- to swim a half mile, bike 12 miles and run 3 miles.

For 64-year-old JOE BOLSTER of Princeton, N.J., Father's Day will mean rising at 4 A.M. to accompany his wife, TINK, age 63, to White Plains, site of the Danskins Women's Triathlon presented by B.M.W.

Tink Bolster, no triathlon tyro, will compete against a field of about 1,000 women next Sunday. She will be the oldest competitor -- but probably not the last -- to swim a half mile, bike 12 miles and run 3 miles.
The couple met 42 years ago on a boat bound for England. Joe, a Princeton track ace, was to run against ROGER BANNISTER of Oxford, the first to run a mile under 4 minutes.
"He ran behind Bannister," Tink said in correction.
Now Joe is just a coach and cheerleader.
